bookings package

Submodules

bookings.app module

bookings.booking_model module

Booking Model Handles all database operations for meeting room bookings.

bookings.booking_model.cancel_booking(booking_id: int, user_id: int | None = None, is_admin: bool = False) → Dict[source]

Cancel a booking.

Parameters:

  • booking_id – The ID of the booking to cancel.

  • user_id – ID of the user making the request (for authorization).

  • is_admin – Whether the user is an admin.

Returns:

Success message or error.

bookings.booking_model.check_room_availability(room_id: int, booking_date: str, start_time: str, end_time: str, exclude_booking_id: int | None = None) → bool[source]

Check if a room is available for a given time slot.

Parameters:

  • room_id – The ID of the room.

  • booking_date – Date of the booking (YYYY-MM-DD format).

  • start_time – Start time (HH:MM:SS format).

  • end_time – End time (HH:MM:SS format).

  • exclude_booking_id – Optional booking ID to exclude from check (for updates).

Returns:

True if room is available, False otherwise.

bookings.booking_model.check_room_exists(room_id: int) → bool[source]

Check if a room exists and is available. First tries to call rooms service via circuit breaker, falls back to direct DB query.

bookings.booking_model.check_user_exists(user_id: int) → bool[source]

Check if a user exists. First tries to call users service via circuit breaker, falls back to direct DB query.

bookings.booking_model.connect_to_db()[source]

Establish connection to PostgreSQL database using secure config.

bookings.booking_model.create_booking(booking_data: Dict) → Dict[source]

Create a new booking.

Parameters:

booking_data – Dictionary containing booking details (user_id, room_id, booking_date, start_time, end_time).

Returns:

Created booking dictionary or error message.

bookings.booking_model.get_all_bookings() → List[Dict][source]

Retrieve all bookings with user and room details.

Returns:

List of booking dictionaries with user and room information.

bookings.booking_model.get_booking_by_id(booking_id: int) → Dict[source]

Retrieve a specific booking by ID.

Parameters:

booking_id – The ID of the booking to retrieve.

Returns:

Booking dictionary or empty dict if not found.

bookings.booking_model.get_conflicting_bookings(room_id: int, booking_date: str, start_time: str, end_time: str) → List[Dict][source]

Get all bookings that conflict with a given time slot. Used for conflict resolution by admins.

Parameters:

  • room_id – The ID of the room.

  • booking_date – Date of the booking (YYYY-MM-DD format).

  • start_time – Start time (HH:MM:SS format).

  • end_time – End time (HH:MM:SS format).

Returns:

List of conflicting booking dictionaries.

bookings.booking_model.get_room_bookings(room_id: int, booking_date: str | None = None) → List[Dict][source]

Retrieve bookings for a specific room, optionally filtered by date.

Parameters:

  • room_id – The ID of the room.

  • booking_date – Optional date to filter bookings (YYYY-MM-DD format).

Returns:

List of booking dictionaries for the room.

bookings.booking_model.get_stuck_bookings() → List[Dict][source]

Get bookings that are in stuck states (e.g., status inconsistencies). Admin can use this to identify and fix stuck bookings.

Returns:

List of potentially stuck booking dictionaries.

bookings.booking_model.get_user_bookings(user_id: int) → List[Dict][source]

Retrieve all bookings for a specific user.

Parameters:

user_id – The ID of the user.

Returns:

List of booking dictionaries for the user.

bookings.booking_model.resolve_booking_conflict(booking_id: int, resolution_action: str, admin_id: int) → Dict[source]

Resolve a booking conflict by admin. Actions: ‘cancel’, ‘modify’, ‘override’

Parameters:

  • booking_id – The ID of the booking to resolve.

  • resolution_action – Action to take (‘cancel’, ‘modify’, ‘override’).

  • admin_id – ID of the admin resolving the conflict.

Returns:

Success message or error.

bookings.booking_model.unblock_stuck_booking(booking_id: int, action: str = 'complete') → Dict[source]

Unblock a stuck booking by admin. Actions: ‘complete’ (mark as completed) or ‘cancel’ (cancel the booking).

Parameters:

  • booking_id – The ID of the stuck booking.

  • action – Action to take (‘complete’ or ‘cancel’).

Returns:

Success message or error.

bookings.booking_model.update_booking(booking_id: int, booking_data: Dict, user_id: int | None = None, is_admin: bool = False) → Dict[source]

Update an existing booking.

Parameters:

  • booking_id – The ID of the booking to update.

  • booking_data – Dictionary containing fields to update.

  • user_id – ID of the user making the request (for authorization).

  • is_admin – Whether the user is an admin.

Returns:

Updated booking dictionary or error message.
